text:
To stabilise an shot you have to apply a transform to it to stop it from moving. Any time you apply a transformation to your shot you do something called filtering.

Ben McEwan explains this really well here.

<https://benmcewan.com/blog/2019/04/22/back-to-basics-a-brief-lesson-on-image-filtering-node-concatentation/>

attachments.title: Back to Basics: A Brief Lesson on Image Filtering & Node Concatentation
attachments.text: Image filtering is a necessary step in many tasks we do in computer graphics, but it often gets little cognisant attention from Compositors. When mentoring junior artists’ recently, I discove…
attachments.fallback: Ben McEwan's Compositing Blog: Back to Basics: A Brief Lesson on Image Filtering & Node Concatentation

text: If you do decide to stabilise your plate, make sure you don't use any automatic methods that introduce factors you can't control
